item.title: Agnes add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "There is something infantile in the presumption that somebody else has a responsibility to give your life meaning and point… The truly adult view, by contrast, is that our life is as meaningful, as full and as wonderful as we choose to make it." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "I am thrilled to be alive at time when humanity is pushing against the limits of understanding. Even better, we may eventually discover that there are no limits." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "A god who is capable of sending intelligible signals to millions of people simultaneously, and of receiving messages from all of them simultaneously, cannot be, whatever else he might be, simple. Such Bandwidth!" -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "I guess my life hasn’t always been happy, or easy, or exactly what I want. At a certain point, I just have to try not to think too much about certain things, or else they’ll break my heart." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Joanne Harris
item.description: "I could do with a bit more excess. From now on I'm going to be immoderate--and volatile--I shall enjoy loud music and lurid poetry. I shall be rampant." -- Joanne Harris

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "The truly creative mind in any field is no more than this: A human creature born abnormally, inhumanly sensitive. To him... a touch is a blow, a sound is a noise, a misfortune is a tragedy, a joy is an ecstasy, a friend is a lover, a lover is a god, and failure is death. Add to this cruelly delicate organism the overpowering necessity to create, create, create -- so that without the creating of music or poetry or books or buildings or something of meaning, his very breath is cut off from him. He must create, must pour out creation. By some strange, unknown, inward urgency he is not really alive unless he is creating." -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Bauvard
item.description: "Everyone praises the endurance of the ascetic, but no one appreciates the stamina of the hedonist. To laugh until the throat burns and smoke a cigar to soothe it, to black out but not pass out, to love without climax, to be immortal in the moment – what stoic has such fortitude?" -- Bauvard

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Saul Bass
item.description: "I want to make beautiful things, even if nobody cares." -- Saul Bass

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Jon Katz
item.description: "I think if I've learned anything about friendship, it's to hang in, stay connected, fight for them, and let them fight for you. Don't walk away, don't be distracted, don't be too busy or tired, don't take them for granted. Friends are part of the glue that holds life and faith together. Powerful stuff." -- Jon Katz

item.title: Agnes add a quote by Julie Delpy
item.description: "I believe if there's any kind of God it wouldn't be in any of us, not you or me but just this little space in between. If there's any kind of magic in this world it must be in the attempt of understanding someone sharing something. I know, it's almost impossible to succeed but who cares really? The answer must be in the attempt." -- Julie Delpy
